result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer C Weidinger

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No contact with River Country Coop.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

11:07 AM case called. Judge John Manydeeds for Branch 3 Intake.
Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jennifer C Weidinger appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Francis Rivard from Eau Claire County Jail.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates their address with the Court.
State requests $200 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defense objects and cites reasoning.
Court orders $5,000 signature bond with conditions.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/14/2022 at 1:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jennifer C Weidinger
Current: Homeless, Eau Claire, WI   (Effective: 11-03-2022)
Prior: 226 N Wisconsin Ave, Rice Lake, WI 54868

Conditions:
No contact with River Country Coop.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
